Posted By: sir_dwar (12/30/2009 8:59:34 AM)
Rating:

@ChampionofSquee

He can "counter" Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, but since your opponent just cast Emrakul he'll still get an extra turn... and there's a good chance Emrakul is coming out on that turn, landing him another extra turn... which means Venser isn't much use against him.

If you're looking to counter Emrakul and other uncounterables, I think you need look no further than Mindbreak Trap.

Posted By: Scormio (5/10/2012 9:31:47 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Works well with the planeswalker: when creature-Venser is on the battlefield, bounce him with 'walker-Venser. Then when creature-Venser enters the battlefield again, bounce him to your hand with his own ability, and bam! recurrable "counterspell". You could even take the time to Wrath the board while creature-Venser is in exile if you want.  
Also worth noting that he abuses etb and cast triggers for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol).
posts.html:
Works well with the planeswalker: when creature-Venser is on the battlefield, bounce him with 'walker-Venser. Then when creature-Venser enters the battlefield again, bounce him to your hand with his own ability, and bam! recurrable "counterspell". You could even take the time to Wrath the board while creature-Venser is in exile if you want.

Posted By: GrimjawxRULES (4/25/2012 10:33:16 AM)
Rating:

The permanent Emrakul can also be targeted by this. When Venser ETB he is a permanent, not a spell. Emrakul won't have protection from it. The same applies to emrakul's interaction with oblivion ring, see http://community.wizards.com/go/thread/view/75842/28910957/?pg=last

@Totema

That only applies to "future shifted" cards with the special "future" border (i.e. Tarmogoyf).

Posted By: adrian.malacoda (4/8/2012 3:31:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @guitarman71084: Yes, the spell Emrakul could be returned to your hand by this, Emrakul only has protection from colored spells when it's a permanent, not as a spell. Since returning a spell to your hand is different than countering, it would get around Emrakul's uncounterable ability too. See Emrakul's rulings about protection.
posts.html:
@guitarman71084: Yes, the spell Emrakul could be returned to your hand by this, Emrakul only has protection from colored spells when it's a permanent, not as a spell. Since returning a spell to your hand is different than countering, it would get around Emrakul's uncounterable ability too. See Emrakul's rulings about protection.
